title: Bash the entertainer: 'To fight racism I used comedy'
description: Social media star says he became funny to fight the racist abuse he suffered at school in Glasgow.

title: Coronavirus: How blind school in Worcester is keeping pupils safe
description: New College Worcester, a school for blind or vision impaired youngsters, is adapting to Covid rules.

title: South Africa: Is 'black tax' help or a burden?
description: Young professionals in South Africa discuss the expectation to financially support their families.

title: Sculptor in Nigeria creates black prosthetic hand for his brother
description: When Ubokobong lost his fingers in an explosion, he struggled to find a realistic artificial black replacement until his brother John stepped in.

title: Should I get a flu jab this winter?
description: Getting a flu jab could help protect you from influenza, but how can it help in the fight against coronavirus?

title: Belly Mujinga: Calls for inquest into alleged 'virus cough attack' death
description: Belly Mujinga died of Covid-19, after reportedly being coughed on by someone saying: "I have the virus."

title: How to get promoted when working from home
description: If you are still not going back to the office, what's the best way to stand out from colleagues?

title: Snowdon: Lloyd Scott starts walk up mountain in diving suit
description: The fundraiser aims to walk up Snowdon on the last leg of a gruelling Three Peaks challenge.

title: Liverpool & Man Utd lead radical English football reform plans
description: Liverpool and Manchester United are leading radical proposals for reform of English football that include an 18-team Premier League.

title: Covid: Second national lockdown possible, says top UK scientist
description: The UK is at a "precarious point" as coronavirus cases continue to rise, warns Prof Peter Horby.

title: Margaret Ferrier: Covid MP says virus 'makes you act out of character'
description: Margaret Ferrier calls the decision to travel from London to Glasgow after testing positive a 'blip'.

title: Robert Jenrick dismisses call for constituency fund probe
description: Labour presses Robert Jenrick over a £25m grant, but he insists the process was "perfectly normal".

title: Covid: Student anger over 'junk' food parcels in isolation
description: University students self-isolating in the UK criticise the cost and quality of food parcels on campus.

title: Nations League: Five more Republic of Ireland players out of Wales game after new positive Covid-19 case
description: Five more Republic of Ireland players are out of Sunday's Nations League game against Wales after a new positive Covid-19 case in the squad.

title: Covid in Scotland: 'No guarantee' pubs will reopen in two weeks
description: Scotland's hospitality minister defends the current closure of pubs and restaurants as part of Covid restrictions.

title: Denver protest death: Demonstrator shot during rival rallies
description: A local TV station says the suspect is a security guard it hired to protect its crew at protests.

title: Northern Ireland must forget Bosnia celebrations - Evans
description: Jonny Evans says Northern Ireland must put their full focus on Sunday's Nations League home game against Austria.

title: Covid: Trump 'no longer a transmission risk to others'
description: White House doctor Sean Conley gives the first update on the US president's health since Thursday.

title: Documentary claims to expose North Korea trying to dodge sanctions
description: A new film claims to shed light on astonishing efforts by North Korea to evade international sanctions.

title: 'Wearing my rainbow mouthpiece was a reminder of what I'd overcome'
description: People from across the world of sport share their stories with BBC Sport as part of National Coming Out Day.

title: BCG: Can a vaccine from 1921 save lives from Covid-19?
description: Vaccines may cause wide-scale changes in the immune system which can boost the body's protection.

title: The Papers: PM dubbed 'new Maggie' amid 'lockdown revolt'
description: Sunday's front pages address contention over local coronavirus rules in the north of England.

title: Covid: Brazil's coronavirus death toll passes 150,000
description: The country, which recently passed five million cases, has the world's second-highest number of dead.

title: Why Paloma Faith is talking frankly about pregnancy
description: The pop star opens up, after her first pregnancy left her "as close to death as I'd ever been".

title: Smash and Angel Delight: 'The mixer that helped my family through hard times'
description: As Covid leaves thousands struggling, Rebecca Stott recalls how her mum coped with a financial disaster in the 1970s.

title: Pub desks: Sick of home working? I made the pub my office for a day
description: Sick of home working? Pubs in the UK have been offering "pub desk" deals to remote-workers.
